fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Culture, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Youth, Research and innovation, External Relations, Trans-European Networks, Communication
eu_initiatives: Creative Europe Programme; Erasmus Programme; External Action Services initiatives; Cultural Ambassadorship Role
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
membership: Member of the European Federation of Youth Orchestras; Association of British Orchestras;
goals__remit:
●    Orchestra: To establish an orchestra of outstanding, dedicated young musicians from the member states of the European Union who work together under internationally renowned and inspiring professors, conductors and soloists to achieve the highest possible standard of orchestral performance.  
●    Performance: To enable the Orchestra to perform each year in major cities and festivals both in the European Union and throughout the world, in a variety of formal and informal events that use the most traditional and the most innovative formats and techniques for diverse audiences. 
●    Culture: To provide an annual opportunity for the participants to to live and work together to develop friendships and understanding, and to increase their awareness of the musical and cultural aspects of Europe’s countries and regions, and Europe’s place in the global culture.  
●    Society: To produce enlightened Europeans equipped to play a part in the welfare and betterment of European and other communities as ambassadors for the EU, demonstrating cooperation, achievement and creativity, and embodying the highest ideals of the European Union.
relevant_communication:
Supporting the capacity of the European cultural sector to operate transnationally and internationally. 
Promoting the circulation of cultural works and the mobility of cultural players, in particular of artists, transnationally. 
Improving access to European cultural and creative works and extending their reach to new audiences. 
Contributing to innovation and creativity in the field of culture. 
Developing skills, competences and know-how, including how to adapt to digital technologies. 
Testing innovative approaches to audience development.t 
Testing new business and management models. 
Enabling international cooperation and career development in the EU and beyond. 
Facilitating access to professional opportunities. 
Organising international cultural activities, such as touring events, exchanges and festivals.
